movie_list.Title: The Shawshank Redemption
movie_list.Writer: Stephen King (short story "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption"), Frank Darabont (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
movie_list.Plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. Another 19 wins & 29 nominations.

movie_list.Title: The Godfather
movie_list.Writer: Mario Puzo (screenplay by), Francis Ford Coppola (screenplay by), Mario Puzo (based on the novel by)
movie_list.Actors: Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Richard S. Castellano
movie_list.Plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

movie_list.Title: The Godfather: Part II
movie_list.Writer: Francis Ford Coppola (screenplay by), Mario Puzo (screenplay by), Mario Puzo (based on the novel by)
movie_list.Actors: Al Pacino, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Robert De Niro
movie_list.Plot: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

movie_list.Title: The Dark Knight
movie_list.Writer: Jonathan Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (screenplay), Christopher Nolan (story), David S. Goyer (story), Bob Kane (characters)
movie_list.Actors: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart, Michael Caine
movie_list.Plot: When the menace known as the Joker emerges from his mysterious past, he wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, the Dark Knight must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

movie_list.Title: 12 Angry Men
movie_list.Writer: Reginald Rose (story), Reginald Rose (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Martin Balsam, John Fiedler, Lee J. Cobb, E.G. Marshall
movie_list.Plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 8 nominations.

movie_list.Title: Schindler's List
movie_list.Writer: Thomas Keneally (book), Steven Zaillian (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley, Ralph Fiennes, Caroline Goodall
movie_list.Plot: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazi Germans.

movie_list.Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
movie_list.Writer: J.R.R. Tolkien (novel), Fran Walsh (screenplay), Philippa Boyens (screenplay), Peter Jackson (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Noel Appleby, Ali Astin, Sean Astin, David Aston
movie_list.Plot: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

movie_list.Title: Pulp Fiction
movie_list.Writer: Quentin Tarantino (stories), Roger Avary (stories), Quentin Tarantino
movie_list.Actors: Tim Roth, Amanda Plummer, Laura Lovelace, John Travolta
movie_list.Plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster's wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

movie_list.Title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
movie_list.Writer: Luciano Vincenzoni (story), Sergio Leone (story), Agenore Incrocci (screenplay), Furio Scarpelli (screenplay), Luciano Vincenzoni (screenplay), Sergio Leone (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Eli Wallach, Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Aldo Giuffrè
movie_list.Plot: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

movie_list.Title: Fight Club
movie_list.Writer: Chuck Palahniuk (novel), Jim Uhls (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Edward Norton, Brad Pitt, Meat Loaf, Zach Grenier
movie_list.Plot: An insomniac office worker, looking for a way to change his life, crosses paths with a devil-may-care soapmaker, forming an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 10 wins & 34 nominations.

movie_list.Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
movie_list.Writer: J.R.R. Tolkien (novel), Fran Walsh (screenplay), Philippa Boyens (screenplay), Peter Jackson (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Alan Howard, Noel Appleby, Sean Astin, Sala Baker
movie_list.Plot: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

movie_list.Title: Forrest Gump
movie_list.Writer: Winston Groom (novel), Eric Roth (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Tom Hanks, Rebecca Williams, Sally Field, Michael Conner Humphreys
movie_list.Plot: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, Vietnam, Watergate, and other history unfold through the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75.

movie_list.Title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
movie_list.Writer: Leigh Brackett (screenplay by), Lawrence Kasdan (screenplay by), George Lucas (story by)
movie_list.Actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
movie_list.Plot: After the rebels are overpowered by the Empire on the ice planet Hoth, Luke Skywalker begins Jedi training with Yoda. His friends accept shelter from a questionable ally as Darth Vader hunts them in a plan to capture Luke.

movie_list.Title: Inception
movie_list.Writer: Christopher Nolan
movie_list.Actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ellen Page, Tom Hardy
movie_list.Plot: A thief, who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology, is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.

movie_list.Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
movie_list.Writer: J.R.R. Tolkien (novel), Fran Walsh (screenplay), Philippa Boyens (screenplay), Stephen Sinclair (screenplay), Peter Jackson (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Bruce Allpress, Sean Astin, John Bach, Sala Baker
movie_list.Plot: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

movie_list.Title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
movie_list.Writer: Lawrence Hauben (screenplay), Bo Goldman (screenplay), Ken Kesey (based on the novel by), Dale Wasserman (the play version: "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" by)
movie_list.Actors: Michael Berryman, Peter Brocco, Dean R. Brooks, Alonzo Brown
movie_list.Plot: A criminal pleads insanity after getting into trouble again and once in the mental institution rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients.

movie_list.Title: Goodfellas
movie_list.Writer: Nicholas Pileggi (book), Nicholas Pileggi (screenplay), Martin Scorsese (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta, Joe Pesci, Lorraine Bracco
movie_list.Plot: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

movie_list.Title: The Matrix
movie_list.Writer: Lilly Wachowski, Lana Wachowski
movie_list.Actors: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Hugo Weaving
movie_list.Plot: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

movie_list.Title: Seven Samurai
movie_list.Writer: Akira Kurosawa (screenplay), Shinobu Hashimoto (screenplay), Hideo Oguni (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Toshirô Mifune, Takashi Shimura, Keiko Tsushima, Yukiko Shimazaki
movie_list.Plot: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 6 nominations.

movie_list.Title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
movie_list.Writer: George Lucas
movie_list.Actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Peter Cushing
movie_list.Plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle-station while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the evil Darth Vader.

movie_list.Title: City of God
movie_list.Writer: Paulo Lins (novel), Bráulio Mantovani (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Alexandre Rodrigues, Leandro Firmino, Phellipe Haagensen, Douglas Silva
movie_list.Plot: Two boys growing up in a violent neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro take different paths: one becomes a photographer, the other a drug dealer.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 66 wins & 38 nominations.

movie_list.Title: Se7en
movie_list.Writer: Andrew Kevin Walker
movie_list.Actors: Morgan Freeman, Andrew Kevin Walker, Kevin Spacey, Daniel Zacapa
movie_list.Plot: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 25 wins & 33 nominations.

movie_list.Title: The Silence of the Lambs
movie_list.Writer: Thomas Harris (novel), Ted Tally (screenplay)
movie_list.Actors: Jodie Foster, Lawrence A. Bonney, Kasi Lemmons, Lawrence T. Wrentz
movie_list.Plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

movie_list.Title: It's a Wonderful Life
movie_list.Writer: Frances Goodrich (screenplay), Albert Hackett (screenplay), Frank Capra (screenplay), Jo Swerling (additional scenes), Philip Van Doren Stern (story)
movie_list.Actors: James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell
movie_list.Plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.
movie_list.Awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 6 wins & 1 nomination.

movie_list.Title: Life Is Beautiful
movie_list.Writer: Vincenzo Cerami (story and screenplay by), Roberto Benigni (story and screenplay by)
movie_list.Actors: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giorgio Cantarini, Giustino Durano
movie_list.Plot: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

movie_list.Title: The Usual Suspects
movie_list.Writer: Christopher McQuarrie
movie_list.Actors: Stephen Baldwin, Gabriel Byrne, Benicio Del Toro, Kevin Pollak
movie_list.Plot: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which began when five criminals met at a seemingly random police lineup.

movie_list.Title: Spirited Away
movie_list.Writer: Hayao Miyazaki
movie_list.Actors: Rumi Hiiragi, Miyu Irino, Mari Natsuki, Takashi Naitô
movie_list.Plot: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

movie_list.Title: Léon: The Professional
movie_list.Writer: Luc Besson
movie_list.Actors: Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman, Danny Aiello
movie_list.Plot: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. Léon and Mathilda form an unusual relationship, as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade.

movie_list.Title: Saving Private Ryan
movie_list.Writer: Robert Rodat
movie_list.Actors: Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Barry Pepper
movie_list.Plot: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

movie_list.Title: Interstellar
movie_list.Writer: Jonathan Nolan, Christopher Nolan
movie_list.Actors: Ellen Burstyn, Matthew McConaughey, Mackenzie Foy, John Lithgow
movie_list.Plot: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.
